noisepp::Pipeline

noisepp::Pipeline< Element > Class Template Reference

#include <NoisePipeline.h>

Inheritance diagram for noisepp::Pipeline< Element >:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

template<class Element>
class noisepp::Pipeline< Element >

In Noise++ the noise generation process is different to other libraries. Instead of calling a noise generation function from your module instances directly, you add your modules to a so called Pipeline. The pipeline internally creates pipeline elements from the specified noise modules. Then you create a cache and start generating.

template<class Element>
void noisepp::Pipeline< Element >::setSeed ( int  seed  )  [inline]

Sets the master seed value.

You have to call this BEFORE adding your modules or this will have no effect.

template<class Element>
int noisepp::Pipeline< Element >::getSeed (  )  const [inline]

Returns the master seed value.

template<class Element>
Cache* noisepp::Pipeline< Element >::createCache (  )  const [inline]

Creates a clean cache.

You need only one cache per pipeline and thread. You have to call this AFTER adding your modules or there will be memory acces errors. Don't forget to free the cache.

template<class Element>
NOISEPP_INLINE void noisepp::Pipeline< Element >::cleanCache ( Cache *  cache  )  const [inline]

Cleans the specified cache.

You should call this each time you use it.

template<class Element>
void noisepp::Pipeline< Element >::freeCache ( Cache *  cache  )  const [inline]

Frees the specified cache.
